newsitem.title: USA: Florida approves $905 million of bond issues.
newsitem.headline: Florida approves $905 million of bond issues.

text.p: Florida officials on Thursday authorized $905 million of education, transportation and regents' bonds, a spokeswoman with the state Division of Bond Finance said.

The package includes authorization for $500 million of Florida Board of Education Public Education Outlay Bonds. Those are general obligation bonds and will be sold in two series, although no date has been set. The bonds will fund projects authorized during the spring legislative session and are backed by gross receipts taxes on utilities.

The state Board of Administration, made up of the governor, treasurer and comptroller, also approved $350 million Department of Transportation Right of Way Acquisition and Bridge Construction Bonds. Those are also general obligation bonds.
The Division of Bond Finance has begun advertising for competitive bids for the transportation bonds, which could be sold as early as next week.

The board also approved $55 million Florida Board of Regents, University System Improvement Revenue Refunding Bonds, to refund the University System Improvement Revenue Certificates, Series 1991. No date has been set for that issue.
